alternative_parents.description: Tertiary alkylarylamines having two aryl and one alkyl groups attached to the amino group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyldiarylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds containing a thioether group that is substituted by two aryl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Diarylthioethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a piperazine ring where the nitrogen ring atom carries an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: N-alkylpiperazines

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
alternative_parents.name: Benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing 1,4-thiazine, a six-member ring with a nitrogen and a sulfur atoms in ring positions 1 and 4 respectively, as well as two double bonds.
alternative_parents.name: 1,4-thiazines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.
alternative_parents.name: 1,2-aminoalcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl fluorides

class.description: Organic compounds containing a benzene fused to a thiazine ring (a six-membered ring with four carbon atoms, one nitrogen atom and one sulfur atom).
class.name: Benzothiazines

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenothiazines. These are polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a phenothiazine moiety, which is a linear tricyclic system that consists of a two benzene rings joined by a para-thiazine ring.

direct_parent.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a phenothiazine moiety, which is a linear tricyclic system that consists of a two benzene rings joined by a para-thiazine ring.
direct_parent.name: Phenothiazines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a phenothiazine moiety, which is a linear tricyclic system that consists of a two benzene rings joined by a para-thiazine ring.
subclass.name: Phenothiazines

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
